node.title: Woman Arrested for Murder of Elderly Man With 'I Touch Little Girls' Written on His Body
node.description: In addition to murder charges, the woman is also facing charges of child abuse in connection with a July incident as police began investigating the murder.

node.title: As Pressure Builds to Fire DeJoy, Post Office Struggles to Meet Holiday Demand
node.description: "If you think getting rid of him solves the problem, it doesn't," Mark Jamison, a retired postmaster from North Carolina, told Newsweek. "The problem is much deeper than DeJoy."

node.title: The Gotham Awards Find a Big Winner in ‘The Lost Daughter’
node.description: The film, adapted from an Elena Ferrante story by the director-writer Maggie Gyllenhaal, took home top feature, among other honors.

node.title: Scientists Create Camera so Small It Could Take Photos of Your Brain
node.description: The tiny camera is capable of producing full-color images on par with a conventional lens 550,000 times its size, according to its creators.

node.title: Manchin Says Inflation, Omicron Should Give Congress 'Cause to Pause' on Biden Social Bill
node.description: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer said his goal is to pass the $1.75 trillion social and climate spending package by Christmas.

node.title: The 10 Best Books of 2021
node.description: Editors at The Times Book Review choose the best fiction and nonfiction titles this year.

node.title: An Earthquake Has Broken Tehran, but She’s Looking for a Different Fix
node.description: “In Case of Emergency,” a novel by Mahsa Mohebali, offers an antic portrait of a mind on edge in contemporary Iran.

node.title: Dutch Find Omicron in Sample From Mid-November, 5 Days Before South Africa Discovery
node.description: The discovery makes even more unclear the timeline and origin of Omicron's emergence as scientists try to figure out how dangerous the COVID variant might be.

node.title: NYC SantaCon 2021: Here's Everything You Need to Know About the Festivities
node.description: The Big Apple hosts the largest SantaCon drinking event, but similar festivities are held in over 40 countries over the Christmas season.

node.title: Former Lesotho prime minister charged with the 2017 murder of his estranged wife
node.description: The former Lesotho prime minister and his current wife got married days after the killing of his estranged wife. The two were in the middle of an acrimonious divorce.

node.title: 'Preventing the suffering of children': MPs in debate over mitochondrial donation
node.description: Federal MPs make heartfelt speeches to Parliament on the ethical quandaries raised by a proposed law that could reduce the risk of children developing a debilitating, and sometimes fatal, genetic disease.

node.title: Trial begins for former officer Kim Potter, charged in killing of Daunte Wright
node.description: Potter, who is white, shot and killed 20-year-old Daunte Wright, who was Black, during a traffic stop in April.

node.title: Testimony to begin in trial of ex-"Empire" actor Jussie Smollett
node.description: Testimony is expected to begin nearly three years after Jussie Smollett was accused of lying to Chicago police when he claimed he was the victim of a racist and homophobic attack.

node.title: Terrifying Videos Show Sex-crazed Elephant Charge at Safari Group, Push Car Off the Road
node.description: The male elephant was with a breeding herd on the Selati Game Reserve in Kruger National Park when the group approached it.

node.title: City Declares Independence From California in Vaccine Protest
node.description: Oroville declared itself a "constitutional republic" in a move against COVID mandates

node.title: Maine Legislator Who Fought Mask Rules Resigns After Wife's Death From COVID
node.description: State Representative Chris Johansen said his wife's death meant he no longer had time to serve in the Legislature.

node.title: Lululemon sues Peloton over patent infringement.
node.description: Lululemon accused Peloton, the fitness company best known for its stationary bikes, of infringing on patents for a new line of leggings and sports bras.

node.title: As Omicron Variant Spreads, Will the COVID Pandemic Ever End?
node.description: The Omicron variant has been designated a variant of concern, two years since the pandemic started, prompting questions about what the future holds.

node.title: A Fashion Stylist Who Found Inspiration in New Surroundings
node.description: Having embraced a slower pace of life upstate, Melissa Ventosa Martin is launching an online marketplace dedicated to finely crafted pieces imbued with the luxury of time.

node.title: What to Know About the Fatal Shooting of Daunte Wright
node.description: Kimberly Potter, a former Minnesota police officer, faces manslaughter charges in the death of Mr. Wright. She called out “Taser! Taser! Taser!” before firing her gun during a traffic stop.

node.title: Pizza Delivery Man Dies After Customer's Porch Collapses Under Him
node.description: William Fields was reportedly a popular member of the community and customers would specifically request he deliver their food.

node.title: Greece to require vaccine for those over 60
node.description: Those who do not get vaccinated will be fined 100 euro ($113.66) every month until they receive the shot.

node.title: Stocks and oil fall on renewed worries about Omicron.
node.description: The S&P 500 is set to open 1 percent lower after the Moderna C.E.O. said there could be a “material drop” in the effectiveness of current vaccines.

node.title: Greece makes vaccines mandatory for people 60 or older, with fines for not complying.
node.description: It is the latest European nation to announce restrictions on the unvaccinated, as the country tries to stem a surge.

node.title: Judge blocks vaccine mandate for health care workers in 10 states
node.description: U.S. District Judge Matthew Schelp said Congress did not authorize the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services to enact the vaccine rule.

node.title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
node.description: Recent commercial real estate transactions in New York.

node.title: Investors Snap Up Metaverse Real Estate in a Virtual Land Boom
node.description: Transactions for properties in digital realms are jumping, guided by the same principle in the physical world: location, location, location.

node.title: Barbados inaugurates President as head of state replacing the Queen
node.description: Barbados removes Queen Elizabeth as head of state, forging a new republic with its first-ever president and severing its last remaining colonial bonds nearly 400 years after the first English ships arrived at the Caribbean island.

node.title: Ghislaine Maxwell sex abuse trial to resume with Epstein pilot's testimony
node.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's criminal sex abuse trial enters its second day, with prosecutors expected to question a longtime pilot of the deceased financier Jeffrey Epstein.

node.title: Taliban promised amnesty, but former Afghan government officers are still being murdered: HRW Report
node.description: The Taliban promised amnesty to those who'd served in the previous Afghan government when it swept to power. Human Rights Watch says that amnesty is being violated.
